entries.content: Starting session with Moti - focusing on custom CSS changes to the code-content parent element in Prism highlighting. Previous session: removed flashy animations, upgraded to Tomorrow Night theme, fixed opacity issues.

Enhancement goal: Add professional polish to .code-content parent element - starting with left/right padding and a simple professional border. Current state is working perfectly, we're improving aesthetics.

Planning enhancements for .code-content element. User wants ALL improvements EXCEPT transitions (#2). Will implement: 1) Depth & Shadow, 3) Border Refinements, 4) Background Subtleties, 5) Typography & Spacing, 6) State Indicators, 7) Polish Details. No animations/transitions - keeping it static and clean.

Successfully implemented all 6 enhancements to .code-content element: depth/shadows, gradient borders, subtle background tint, balanced spacing, streaming state indicators, and polish details. No transitions - all static. File: base.css:28-73
User feedback: Removed top border (cleaner look) and increased bottom margin from 8px to 16px for better vertical spacing between code blocks.
Added text overflow handling to .code-content: overflow-wrap, word-break for wrapping long words, plus overflow-x auto for horizontal scroll fallback on very long lines.
Changed .code-content background from subtle blue tint to --black-gradient for richer depth. Removed override in streaming state to keep consistent gradient throughout.

Fixed backwards streaming state logic! Now: COMPLETE code = BRIGHT border (0.8→0.5 opacity), STREAMING code = SUBTLE border (0.4→0.2 opacity). Makes semantic sense - finished code gets the prominent border.

Created delta memory for code-content professional styling enhancement session. Captured all iterative refinements: gradient borders, black gradient background, depth shadows, balanced spacing, text overflow handling, and corrected streaming state logic.
